bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 162, Number 109 (Thursday, July 7, 2016)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. BRADY of Pennsylvania:H.R. 5661.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I.[Page H4549]

item.title: Continuing Appropriations and Military Construction, Veterans Affairs, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2017, and Zika Response and Preparedness Act

latestAction.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 473.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

summary.text: This bill establishes a Flag Office Revolving Fund for the Architect of the Capitol to use for expenses in connection with services provided by the Flag Office, including: (1) supplies, inventories, equipment, and other expenses; and (2) reimbursement of any appropriations account for the salaries of employees of the Flag Office.

bill.title: To establish the Flag Office Revolving Fund for services provided by the Flag Office of the Architect of the Capitol.

item.title: To establish the Flag Office Revolving Fund for services provided by the Flag Office of the Architect of the Capitol.
To establish the Flag Office Revolving Fund for services provided by the Flag Office of the Architect of the Capitol.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on House Administration.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
